command: [Net.ServicePointManager]::SecurityProtocol=[Net.SecurityProtocolType]::Tls12; $ts=Get-Date -Format o; try { $b=[Convert]::ToBase64String([Text.Encoding]::ASCII.GetBytes("$env:CENSYS_ID`:$env:CENSYS_SECRET")); $headers=@{ 'Authorization'="Basic $b"; 'Accept'='application/json' }; $body=@{ q='services.tls.certificates.leaf_data.subject_dn:contoso.com'; per_page=10 } | ConvertTo-Json; $r=Invoke-WebRequest -Uri 'https://search.censys.io/api/v2/hosts/search' -Method Post -Headers $headers -ContentType 'application/json' -Body $body -ErrorAction Stop; ($r.Content | ConvertFrom-Json | ConvertTo-Json -Depth 6) | Out-File -FilePath "$env:TEMP\censys_hosts_contoso.json" -Encoding utf8; Add-Content -Path "$env:TEMP\recon.log" -Value "$ts Censys success contoso.com" } catch { Add-Content -Path "$env:TEMP\recon.log" -Value "$ts Censys error: $($_.Exception.Message)" }
explanation: Posts an authenticated query to Censys Search v2 (account-gated) to retrieve host data referencing the target's certificate subject, limiting results to reduce noise and saving structured output.
rationale_steps: Authenticate using Basic token from environment variables.
Submit targeted query with pagination controls to a closed-source service.
Capture and persist structured JSON results.
